intro: Bupleurum rigidum subsp. paniculatum, commonly known as the rigid valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a slightly serrated edge, and the plant often thrives in moist, calcareous soils. It is commonly found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
